image.altText: A drone view shows houses destroyed during the Israeli offensive in Beit Hanoun, northern Gaza Strip.

props.synopsis: The Israeli military says they are conducting extensive strikes on Hamas targets in Gaza, while medics report casualties in a series of the most violent air strikes since the ceasefire began. Follow live.

title.children: Israel launches 'extensive' strikes on Gaza, most violent since January ceasefire

image.altText: Four men and one woman, all wearing suits, walk in front of the Reserve Bank of Australia building in Sydney.

props.synopsis: The Reserve Bank's chief economist says current economic uncertainty, especially around US tariffs, makes forecasting and rate setting more difficult, as Macquarie Bank warns Donald Trump's economic policies run the risk of sparking a stock market crash.

title.children: RBA watching US economy as Macquarie warns of potential share crash

image.altText: Toyah Cordingley sits with her dogs.

props.synopsis: The 24-year-old health store worker's body was found with a slashed throat and multiple stab wounds on a beach north of Cairns, the court heard.

title.children: Jury in trial of man accused of murdering Toyah Cordingley discharged

image.altText: The returning crew inside the SpaceX Dragon spacecraft docked with the International Space Station.

props.synopsis: After nine months stranded in space, Butch Wilmore and Suni Williams will soon take off in a SpaceX capsule bound for Earth. Follow live.

title.children: Stranded astronauts board capsule to return to Earth

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: Four departing crew pose for final photos

image.altText: Prince Harry at a conference in a suit

props.synopsis: A federal judge ordered the release of Harry's visa records, which could reveal if he disclosed prior drug use before he came to the US.

title.children: Prince Harry's US visa record is being made public. Here's what we know

image.altText: Lilie James, who was found dead at St Andrew's Cathedral School on October 25, 2023, in 2020 in graduation outfit and hat

props.synopsis: An inquest has begun into the death of Lilie James, who was killed by her former short-term partner, Paul Thijssen, in Sydney's CBD in October 2023.

title.children: Evidence Lilie James's killer 'rehearsed' fatal attack, inquest told

image.altText: A damaged plane with black marks after flames.

props.synopsis: A fire that destroyed a South Korean plane prompts closer examination of lithium-ion battery safety, with some airlines starting to change their rules.

title.children: South Korea plane fire traced to power bank, airlines enforce new rules

image.altText: A child playing with magnetic plastic shapes on a surface. The child's face can't be seen.

props.synopsis: With centres reassessed on average every four years, and some gaming the system, parents cannot be sure their child's centre meets the standards or that staff are properly trained or qualified.

title.children: Australia's childcare rating system labelled 'a joke' as failing centres stay open for years

image.altText: Power lines and electricity poles are seen with the Melbourne skyline in the distance on a mostly clear day.

props.synopsis: Households are once again bracing for another round of power bill hikes. But for a nation that is one of the world's biggest energy exporters, it's a situation that defies logic and reeks of an epic policy failure.

title.children: The epic policy failure that's to blame for rising household power bills

image.altText: Chalmers looks serious as he stares out of frame.

props.synopsis: The damage of a global trade war would put a multi-billion-dollar dent in Australia's economy by 2030, Treasurer Jim Chalmers says ahead of next week's federal budget.

title.children: Treasurer flags no big budget improvement, issues grim trade war warning

image.altText: Sara Duterte and Ferdinand Marcos Jr after their win.

props.synopsis: She threatened to hire a hit man to take out the president. He got his revenge. Welcome to politics Philippines style.

title.children: The explosive family feud that led to Rodrigo Duterte's arrest

image.altText: A woman with bright red hair rests her chin on her arm

props.synopsis: An Australian relative of a singer who was among those who died when a fire tore through a nightclub in a former carpet warehouse says her family is angry at local authorities.

title.children: Grief turns to anger for family of singer killed in North Macedonia nightclub fire

image.altText: Bounty offer letter for Kevin Yam

props.synopsis: A prominent Hong Kong pro-democracy advocate vows not to be intimidated after an anonymous letter advertising a police bounty was circulated in Melbourne.

title.children: Melbourne residents receive 'wanted' letter for Hong Kong pro-democracy activist

image.altText: Usain Bolt bites his Olympic gold medal

props.synopsis: Twelve months before redefining the 100m sprint at the Beijing Olympics, Usain Bolt had to convince his coach, Glen Mills, to let him run in the event by winning a bet.

title.children: Usain Bolt reveals he was a bet away from never running 100m events

image.altText: The Vivienne Drag Queen wearing a blue shimmery dress with their leg up on a chair and a blonde/grey hair do

props.synopsis: The family of James Lee Williams — better known as drag star The Vivienne — is calling for more awareness about increasing rates of recreational ketamine use.

title.children: Drag star The Vivienne died from ketamine use, says family

image.altText: green egg carton with one single egg

props.synopsis: Egg shortages are predicted to continue for at least three years. We look at substitutes you can use to keep things moving in your kitchen.

title.children: Egg shortages are predicted for the next three years. Here are some substitutes

props.synopsis: Around the clock coverage of news events as they break at home and abroad.

title.children: ABC News Channel live

image.altText: Active Super app viewed on an iPhone, held in someone's hand

props.synopsis: The Australian share market has lifted after a bounce on Wall Street. The Federal Court fines Active Super $10.5 million. Follow the day's events and insights from our business reporters on the ABC News live markets blog.

title.children: Active Super hit with $10.5 million penalty for greenwashing

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: Active Super hit with penalty for greenwashing
NAB CEO warns Trump's 'tariff madness' may end rate cuts
Westpac expands fund for women in business

image.altText: A drone shot of rows of newly built houses next to green land.

props.synopsis: Farming groups are opposed to the South Australian government removing protections for land near Adelaide to allow for more housing, but the premier says the change is needed for the city's growing population.

title.children: Plan to turn farms into suburbs amid a housing crunch angers farmers

image.altText: A man stands on a sporting oval that is covered in white hail stones. He is holding four large hail stones.

props.synopsis: The 1999 Sydney hailstorm was a transformative moment for emergency disaster response and highlighted the immense costs of extreme weather.

title.children: Without warning, ice balls pelted Sydney in Australia's most expensive natural disaster

image.altText: Merredith Hammat smiling, sitting among other Labor MPs.

props.synopsis: Meredith Hammat is handed the health portfolio as Roger Cook announces sweeping changes to his WA ministry, including the creation of new portfolios and ministers for each of the state’s regions.

title.children: First-time minister put in charge of health as WA premier reshuffles cabinet

image.altText: dead octopus about the length of six mobile phones on a beach

props.synopsis: Dead octopuses have been found along South Australian beaches as environment authorities say a microalgae bloom could be to blame for fish deaths on the weekend.

title.children: Microalgae bloom likely cause after surfers reportedly falling ill at SA beach

image.altText: A boy seen swimming underwater holding a floating board

props.synopsis: Royal Life Saving research shows nearly half of school children entering their teens are failing to attain basic swimming skills, making thousands vulnerable to drowning in adulthood.

title.children: Decline in swimming abilities puts a generation at risk

image.altText: Deanna Coates eyes are seen in the rearview mirror of her car, with red car tail lights visible in front.

props.synopsis: While most of Australia is sleeping, more than 1 million workers are supporting the $174 billion night-time economy.

title.children: As she delivers groceries by night, Deanna joins a 'hidden' workforce

image.altText: TAX CUTS Peter Dutton, Jane Hume, Angus Taylor 20240206_012902275_iOS

props.synopsis: The Coalition's proposed limit for the rate of taxation has not been exceeded for nearly 20 years, and the party appears reluctant to offer new tax cuts before the election.

title.children: Coalition's tax 'speed limit' branded 'shallow' and would not require tax cuts

image.altText: Donald Trump and Vladimir Putin

props.synopsis: The US president says he wants to discuss land and the future of Ukraine's power plants and "dividing up certain assets" on the call with his Russian counterpart.

title.children: Trump, Putin to talk as 30 countries set to join post-war Ukraine 'coalition'

image.altText: A non-identifiable child playing with toys.

props.synopsis: A former childcare provider with over 30 years experience in the sector says the ACT's childcare regulator lacks teeth, with a recent report showing the territory has the second highest rate of serious incidents in the sector.

title.children: ACT childcare centres record second highest rate of 'serious incidents'

image.altText: A herd of AACo's wagyu heifers at Westholme station in Queensland.

props.synopsis: A theory for their cause of death was that a tap from a water tank to a trough was accidentally off. The deaths have horrified people in the agriculture industry, and marks more turmoil at AACo.

title.children: Two herds of cattle owned by luxury beef giant AACo die in one month

image.altText: A close up of PJ Harvey's face as she performs. She holds a mic and looks out to the crowd.

props.synopsis: In a rare interview, PJ Harvey discusses her career of constant renewal and reinvention, and pushing through the fear of failure when trying something new.

title.children: Even after 35 years, PJ Harvey still feels impostor syndrome

image.altText: Donald Trump speaks to a group of journalists and camera operators while standing in a doorway.

props.synopsis: Donald Trump has warned Tehran will "suffer the consequences" of any further attacks by Yemen's Houthi rebels.

title.children: Trump says Iran will be held responsible for Houthi attacks

image.altText: Taylah, wearing a blue football jersey, holds a ball, looking pensive.

props.synopsis: Taylah Moore is "terrified" that political agendas in America could influence Australian politics and result in her not being able to play in her community league.

title.children: Trans Aussie Rules player 'terrified' her right to play could be taken away

image.altText: exterior of a building that says law courts

props.synopsis: A man who sexually assaulted two of his daughters more than a dozen times has had his jail term cut after an appeals court found the sentence was "manifestly excessive".

title.children: 'Difficult day' as man who raped daughters has sentence cut by 18 years

image.altText: Julia Jacklin at Panama Festival

props.synopsis: Another music event has announced it is taking a break, with Tasmania's Panama festival not going ahead in 2026.

title.children: Tasmania's Panama festival won't run in 2026, as founders claim logging threatens site

image.altText: An orange and black Formula One car driving partially on the asphalt track, partially on gravel.

props.synopsis: A new rule implementing cooling systems for F1 drivers was introduced this year. Racing is hot work at the best of times, so how does the new rule help?

title.children: F1 drivers contend with extreme heat and G-forces. Here's how they cope
